metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9744 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Memory leak in PolarSSL before 1.3.9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a large number of ClientHello messages.  NOTE: this identifier was SPLIT from CVE-2014-8628 per ADT3 due to different affected versions.

criterions.comment: polarssl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
